summary: This document is an email forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) from an anonymous individual claiming to be a previously unknown victim of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein. The writer, a lifelong model, offers information about Maxwell and identifies Jean Luc Brunel as a central, more severe figure in international sex trafficking.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified by the email writer as a perpetrator and co-conspirator with Jeffrey Epstein, though described as 'nothing compared' to Jean Luc Brunel.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a co-conspirator with Ghislaine Maxwell; the writer identifies as a victim of 'MAXWELL/Epstein'.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Identified by the writer as Epstein's partner, the writer's former agent, and described as '100x worse than Maxwell' and the 'MAN who for 40 years traffic women internationally'.

connections.description: The writer identifies as a victim of both, linking them together as perpetrators.
The writer explicitly states 'Epstein's partner Jean Luc Brunel'.
Both are implicated by the writer as part of the same network of abuse, with Brunel described as far more severe.
The writer states Brunel was her modeling agent.
The writer explicitly identifies as a victim of Maxwell.
The writer explicitly identifies as a victim of Epstein.

events.title: Victim Outreach to Prosecutors
events.description: An anonymous individual sends an email to the U.S. Attorney's Office identifying themselves as a previously unknown victim of Maxwell and Epstein, and offering information.

keyFacts: An anonymous lifelong model and former teen runaway identifies herself as a previously unknown victim of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The victim claims to have social and professional connections to the network, having been at parties with 'them all' and having Jean Luc Brunel as her agent.
Jean Luc Brunel is characterized as Epstein's partner and a far more severe figure than Maxwell, accused of trafficking women internationally for 40 years.
The correspondence is dated November 14, 2021, after Maxwell's conviction, indicating ongoing victim outreach and potential new information for investigators.
